column4: hello all...I'm about to go to bed, what is the most thorough scan of my system that I can run while I sleep?
restart at least 40 times and wait for a disc scan
I already did an fsck in single user mode
lol. yeah i mean if you're running linux you shouldnt need to run any scan for a typical user.
understood, but my system is kinda suffering from to many improper shutdowns.  it keeps hanging on shutdown due to a bug in the wireless
an automated scan wouldnt fix that.
earlier tonight I was experiencing major weirdness with connectivity and such, which prompted me to try some maintenance
network weirdness? i love the internets and stuff. what was happeneing? this is wireless i take it?
so I don't have to worry about random corruptions, or anything outside of the journal that might not be checked?
yeah, wireless.  I used to think it was 'cause of wpa_supplicant, but I disabled wpa on my home wifi and it still happens
id say if you're having a problem with the inner-nut-webs its not going to effect your system as a whole.
whenever I connect to my home wireless, and subsequently try to shutdown my computer, the shutdown scripts start to run, but hang with some error I have written down somewhere
what problem are you having? what are the symptoms? also what wifi card do you have?
and the only way to fully shutdown at that point is to do a hard shutdown
or spit it out here whatevers.
